p: Contamination of surfaces and equipment are well-documented sources of nosocomial infections, where infected individuals interact with surrounding surfaces and ‘high-touch surfaces’ and facilitate the transmission of microbes to other patients and health care workers [ [13], [14], [15], [16]]. Some of the organisms identified in the studies mentioned include vancomycin-resistant enterococci (VRE), methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA), Clostridium difficile ( C. diff), Pseudomonas aeruginosa, Acinetobacter baumannii and Klebsiella pneumoniae.
